Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase II (COVID-19): Improved 5G Network Performance and Demand Prediction in a Virtually Connected World
Award.AbstractNarration: The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will be to ensure accessible, reliable, high-speed internet. Operators spend $350 B annually on network upgrades, but only an estimated 75% of this is effective. This project will help improve the efficiency of upgrades by providing hyper-local information about network demand as well as forecasting future needs. This can be applied both to upgrading current networks and deployment of future 5G networks, and it improves energy efficiency by aligning resources with needs. This technology will enable ongoing and improved operation in fields ranging from education, emergency responders, government work, and corporate activities during the COVID-19 pandemic and the associated social distancing. <br/><br/>This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project will develop a novel prediction platform for efficient long-term planning of 4G and 5G mobile networks. This project will develop a platform that can accurately forecast network usage and behavior based on key performance indicators and external contextual data. The platform will provide accurate data regarding network demand at the micro-scale, localized by individual cell sites and frequency bands; this will enable better capacity optimization (i.e., when, where, how much).<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In the fast-evolving landscape of telecommunications, where the demand for seamless connectivity is ever-increasing, our project embarked on a groundbreaking journey to revolutionize network planning. Funded by the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II award, our endeavor aimed at addressing both the intellectual merit and broader impacts of our work. Today, we are thrilled to share the transformative outcomes that have unfolded over the life of this award.

Overview of the Project: Our project, titled "5G Network Performance and Demand Prediction for Smart Cities," was conceived with the vision of ushering in a new era of intelligent network planning. As we delved into the challenges of 5G deployment and the complexities of smart city initiatives, we sought to develop an innovative solution that would not only meet the demands of today but also anticipate the needs of tomorrow.

Intellectual Merit: The intellectual merit of our work lies in the development of an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-assisted network planning platform. This platform goes beyond traditional methods by integrating diverse temporal and spatial data sources, allowing for accurate short-term and long-term demand predictions. Our predictive models leverage advanced algorithms to optimize WiFi, LTE, and 5G networks for both indoor and outdoor environments. This intellectual innovation represents a significant advancement in the field of network planning, offering unprecedented accuracy and efficiency.

Broader Impacts: The broader impacts of our project extend far beyond the realms of academia and engineering. At the heart of our efforts is the mission to enhance connectivity, drive economic growth, and contribute to the development of smart and sustainable cities.

Summary of Outcomes: Over the life of the award, our project has achieved remarkable outcomes, from securing patents for innovative technologies to establishing collaborations with major network operators. The AI-assisted network planning platform is not just a technological achievement; it is a catalyst for positive change in connectivity, economic growth, smart city development, and environmental sustainability.

As we reflect on the journey of this project, we envision a future where intelligent network planning is not just a technological necessity but a cornerstone for building a connected, inclusive, and sustainable world. Our outcomes underscore the transformative potential of research and innovation, demonstrating how advancements in network planning can resonate across industries, communities, and the global landscape.
